comment_1:
One of the most beautiful and most timeless ballads ever.And one that can hold a deep personal meaning for each listener(in my opinion).

I always think of the 'door' as being somewhat symbolic of someone's heart and the long and winding road as both geographic and symbolic of the long road to gain or regain someone's trust(heart).The singer may have once held the other person's heart(door)or was on the road to doing so,but was 'left standing there',and through all their wanderings they are still 'led back' because despite the door(heart)being so hard to reach it was still the one door(heart)they knew would open to them.

'The wild and windy night
that the rain washed away
has left a pool of tears
crying for the day'
To me this symbolizes some turmoil or other that even once seemingly overcame has left an emptiness and need,that can only be filled by reaching the end of the long winding road and the door/heart though the singer is uncertain he/she will ever get there.The theme throughout the song is uncertainty,will the road ever finally end,and where?
Though definitely a love song,I feel it's very different than the typical love song in the sense that it's about finally knowing who you should be with yet the road there is still difficult.
comment_2: Technically weezer, this isn't the Beatles last album.  Abbey Road is.  The disappointment and despair of the Get Back sessions led the Beatles to try and attempt one more album before they broke up, which was Abbey Road.  Let It Be came out after Abbey Road though because a different producer was working with Let It Be and he just screwed it all up, especially on the overdubbing of the Long and Winding Road.
comment_3: The song is inspired by the road down the Kintyre peninsula of Scotland to Paul's home (still owns it) in Machrihanish where Paul retreated to get away from mayhem of the Beatles. There are actually two roads to his place - the coastal road takes a little longer to drive but the ocean views are indescribably beautiful. Definitely a bit of a nowheresville down there even today but very pretty.

comment_45:
McCartney is trying to express his lonely feeling through this song.

"The long and winding road that leads to your door"
McCartney implies that he is in a hard situation by comparing it to "the long and winding road". It means that he has not been able to reach his other group members.
"will never disappear" implies that he thinks he will never be able to reach them.
"I've seen that road before" implies that he has always been felt the same way for a long time.
"It always leads me here, lead me your door" implies that he is not successful at reaching the other members, and he wants them to show him how to reach them.
"many times I've been alone" says that he has been feeling alone, and "and many times I've cried" says the situation is so hard for him that he has cried. 
"anyway, you'll never know the many ways I've tried" implies that he thinks the other members will never know how he has always been trying hard to reach them.
"but still they lead me back to the long and winding road" this implies that despite the fact he is trying, he cannot make the situation better.
"you left me standing here a long long time ago" implies that he was left by the other members a long time ago.
"don't keep me waiting here" implies that he doesn't want them to just leave him alone.
"lead me to your door" implies that he wants the other members to show how to them.
"The wild and windy night that the rain washed away" compares how much he has been going through with "the wild and windy night" and says that the hard situation stole so many things from him like his friendship between the other members. 
"has left a pool of tears"implies that the situation only leaves him in a sad feeling.
"crying for the day" implies that he wants to get out of the dark and find a hope. 
"don't leave me waiting here (don't keep me waiting)" says that he wants them to are for him, and 
"let me know the way" implies that he does not know how to reach them and he wants them to show him how to.

This song was made about the time when McCartney wanted to get out of the group because of difference in opinions between other group members. He went back in time when he slowly understood how it was hard to make everybody agree on a same opinion. I liked this song simply because the melody is beautiful, but now that I studied the lyrics, I love it more because I like the way he compares a winding road to the situation which he was in.
